page.title: 03The Grantham Canal-Kinoulton
page.content: The {Grantham Canal}is 33 miles long.The canal itself is a very peaceful and quiet place.Every day many people go walking along its banks.There are lots of{Wild Flowers} growing e.g. cowslips,hop trefoil tufted vetch,red campion and bird's-foot trefoil which many people call 'eggs and bacon'.Hovering around the hedges there are lots of blue dragonflies and colourful butterflies. In the summer people see Mallard ducks,moorhens and swans with their young.Also there are goats grazing on the banks.In winter the canal some- times freezes over and people skate on it. Many years ago the canal was a busy place and{barges}would sail up and down carrying many goods to the village.Now the noise and bustle of { {barges}are just memories.
